text: Todd Solondz (born October 15, 1959) is an American independent film screenwriter, director, and playwright known for his style of dark, thought-provoking, socially conscious satire. Solondz has been critically acclaimed for his examination of the "dark underbelly of middle class American suburbia," a reflection of his own background in New Jersey. His work includes Welcome to the Dollhouse (1995), Happiness (1998), Storytelling (2001),  Palindromes (2004), Life During Wartime (2009), Dark Horse (2011), and Wiener-Dog (2016).
